[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Group Order Validation] Do operations validate that all group elements have the correct prime order, or can low-order elements be injected enabling small-subgroup attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Point Validation] Are all group elements validated to be on the correct curve/group before operations, or can invalid point attacks bypass cryptographic security? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Scalar Reduction] Are scalars properly reduced modulo the group order, or can out-of-range scalars cause unexpected behavior or security vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Constant-Time Implementation] Are all cryptographic operations implemented in constant time, or do timing variations leak sensitive information during validator operations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Exception Handling] Do group operations handle exceptional cases (infinity points, zero scalars) correctly without panicking or leaking information? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Type Safety] Does Rust's type system prevent mixing incompatible group implementations (e.g., BLS12-381 with Curve25519), or can type confusion cause security failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Error Propagation] Are errors from group operations properly propagated to callers, or are they silently swallowed causing incorrect cryptographic computations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Memory Corruption] Can arithmetic overflows or buffer overflows in group operations cause memory corruption leading to RCE on validator nodes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [Fault Injection] Are operations resistant to fault injection attacks where attackers induce hardware faults during computation to leak keys or forge signatures? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [All Functions] [API Misuse] Can developers easily misuse the ElGamal API in ways that compromise security, such as reusing randomness or skipping validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Key Storage] How are ElGamal private keys stored in Aptos validators - are they properly encrypted at rest, or can file system access leak keys enabling fund theft? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Key Rotation] Does Aptos support safe ElGamal key rotation, or can key rotation races cause validators to use mismatched keys leading to decryption failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Cross-Module RNG] Do different Aptos modules share RNG instances with ElGamal operations, potentially causing RNG state correlation or entropy exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Serialization Security] How are ElGamal keys and ciphertexts serialized - can deserialization vulnerabilities enable injection of malicious keys or ciphertexts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Network Transmission] Are ElGamal ciphertexts authenticated during network transmission, or can man-in-the-middle attackers modify ciphertexts in transit? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Consensus Integration] If ElGamal is used in consensus messages, can malformed ciphertexts cause consensus failures or network partitions across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [State Persistence] Are encrypted states using ElGamal properly committed to AptosDB, or can inconsistencies between encrypted and decrypted states cause data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [API Exposure] Does the REST API expose ElGamal operations to untrusted users, enabling chosen ciphertext attacks or decryption oracle access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Gas Metering] Are ElGamal encryption/decryption operations properly gas metered, or can attackers abuse expensive crypto operations for denial-of-service without paying gas? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Integration] [Move Integration] If ElGamal is callable from Move contracts, can malicious contracts exploit cryptographic operations to bypass access controls or steal funds? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Curve25519 Integration] [Implementation Bugs] Does the Curve25519 implementation properly handle edge cases like low-order points, or can these be exploited in the ElGamalFriendlyGroup trait? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Curve25519 Integration] [Cofactor Handling] Does the Curve25519 implementation properly clear the cofactor during operations, or can small-subgroup attacks leak key bits? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Curve25519 Integration] [Torsion Points] Can attackers inject torsion points into encryptions or keys, enabling attacks that extract private key bits through repeated decryptions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Curve25519 Integration] [Compressed Point Handling] Are compressed Curve25519 points properly validated during decompression, or can invalid encodings cause security failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-crypto/src/elgamal/mod.rs] [Curve25519 Integration] [Constant-Time Operations] Does the underlying curve25519-dalek library provide constant-time operations, or can timing attacks on the trait implementation leak keys? (Critical)
